content.body: If you invoke an op that returns a Completion Record, and you don't mark it with `!`, `?`, or `Completion()`, is that an editorial error? Seems like that was one of the points of 2547, but I don't see it in the spec.

Okay, I was just curious.
The non-tangent is that I've found a class of editorial errors/bugs of the form:
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: The non-tangent is that I've found a class of editorial errors/bugs of the form:

content.body:
```
  1. Let _CR_ be the result of evaluation |Something|.
  1. Let _notCR_ be ? GetValue(_CR_).
  1. something involving _CR_ that assumes it isn't a Completion Record.
```

content.body: E.g. https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-function-calls-runtime-semantics-evaluation
steps 4, 5, 6, 9
Steps 6 and 9 are handling `_ref_` as if it's been implicitly unwrapped.

content.body: I think putting a `?` before "the result of evaluating" would avoid the error and preserve semantics (because of what `? GetValue(_CR_)` does).
content.formatted_body: I think putting a ? before "the result of evaluating" would avoid the error and preserve semantics (because of what ? GetValue(_CR_) does).

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: I think putting a `?` before "the result of evaluating" would avoid the error and preserve semantics (because of what `? GetValue(_CR_)` does).
I think putting a ? before "the result of evaluating" would avoid the error and preserve semantics (because of what ? GetValue(_CR_) does).

content.body: However, you can't just put `?` before *every* occurrence of "the result of evaluating", because they aren't all immediately followed by `? GetValue()`.

content.body: No, there are some others
E.g., in evaluation of a Block, you have to reset the the running execution context's LexicalEnvironment before returning the result of evaluating |StatementList|.
